Content: Former Navy media spokesman commodore D.K.P. Dassanayake and the other five seamen were further remanded until August 10th. They were produced before Colombo Fort Magistrate Lanka Jayarathna today. Commodore Dassanayake was arrested on July 10th in connection with allegedly abducting 11 youths, detaining illegally and making them disappear in 2008 and 2009. The lawyers appeared for the affected party stated that the CID is biased in its investigations. Later, the Magistrate ordered CID to arrest the rest of the suspects. Former Navy media spokesman was produced before Court today. Doctors of the Naval Hospital have submitted a medical report over the health condition of commodore Dassanayake. He is still receiving treatment at naval Hospital at Welisara.
